text: So as the name says, an NNF publication is like a publication, but tiny.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And on top of that, it's a publication, it's not just written in English or any natural language.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: But it's written in, you could say, a logic language.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: If you're a bit familiar with semantic web or linked data technologies, it's written in the RDF language, which means it's made of sentences where you have subject, predicate, object, and all the three of them are globally unique identifiers.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: So people around the globe can say things and when they talk about the same thing it will automatically connect.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: If I may kind of simplify it a bit.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: So nanoproductions are kind of these tiny snippets of such statements.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: In the simplest case it's just a single such sentence with something is related with that thing to that thing.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: Like I know in the
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: In medicine, it could be this gene has this kind of effect on this disease.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: Often, it's more than one such triple, as they're called, because often statements are a bit more complex than just a simple triple.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: And that together, so these couple of statements then consist the main content of nanopublication, which is called the assertion.
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: But then it always has some provenance to it, meaning you can state with another such triple,
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: where this came from for example because you had a study that delivered it or because it was extracted from an existing paper or data set or whatever and then it has some metadata where you can say who created it with which tool with a timestamp with a license and these things and all that together then is a nano publication it gets a stable persistent identifier of its own
speaker: SPEAKER_02

text: and the the thing that we are now working with the thing that we are providing is that you're building a decentralized ecosystem for dealing with such nano publications so you can push them to the world basically to the nano application network and it can then live at different places so when you're later uh you or somebody else want to retrieve it again you can and because it has this formal structure you can also ask very specific queries that can then precisely be answered
speaker: SPEAKER_02
